title: A brief introduction to Ventoy
description: The first time I make a bootable USB disk is to install Ubuntu in my Lenovo laptop by Rufus which is very inconvenient as all files are deleted after reformatting the U disk and only one system could be in the U disk which means you have to reformat it again if you want to try another system.

children.value: The first time I make a bootable USB disk is to install Ubuntu in my Lenovo laptop by Rufus which is very inconvenient as
all files are deleted after reformatting the U disk
only one system could be in the U disk
which means you have to reformat it again if you want to try another system.
If you are having the same trouble as me, Ventoy is a good choice then.
How to get quick started with Ventoy?
enter this official website and install it as the instruction.
Insert your U drive and make sure that your computer have detected it.
Follow the default settings and reformat your u disk, take caution that all your files in that u disk will be deleted so back up important files in it.
Put the ISO file in your reformatted U disk and a bootable disk is done.
You could use your U disk as a normal drive while it's a bootable disk which could contain more than one ISO files only restricted by the facility of your U disk.
